interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Penelope
Review Date: 2008/05/21
Store: Richard Grant  (Actor),     Catherine O'Hara  (Actor),     Mark Palansky  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Comedy
Product Description: ['Born with the snout of a pig, young Penelope Wilhern (Christina Ricci) spends life a virtual prisoner in her home. Believing that the only way to break the curse is to marry one of her own kind, she meets a number of suitors, but all reject her. Two devious men, one with a grudge against the family, hire a man (James McAvoy) to pose as a suitor, but complications arise when he begins to fall in love with Penelope, and she makes a bid for freedom.']
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Item model number': '6104618', 'Director': 'Mark Palansky', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, AC-3, Full Screen, NTSC, Subtitled, Dolby, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 30 minutes', 'Release date': 'July 15, 2008', 'Actors': "Richard Grant, Catherine O'Hara, Christina Ricci, Peter Dinklage, James McAvoy", 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Producers': 'Jennifer Simpson, Reese Witherspoon, Scott Steindorff', 'Studio': 'Lionsgate', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: This was such a fun movie.  The tale is great and the acting is wonderful.  James McAvoy is so cute and sweet.  I really enjoyed the sets, especially Penelope's bedroom, it is full of magic and imagination.  Her wardrobe leaves me drooling as well.  This is an entertaining and fun movie and I've been waiting for it to be released on DVD ever since I saw it in the theater.
Review Title: A wonderful fun movie
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
The Talented Mr. Ripley
Matt Damon  (Actor),     Gwyneth Paltrow  (Actor),     Anthony Minghella  (Director, Writer)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    R    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Drama
["To be young and carefree amid the blue waters and idyllic landscape of sun-drenched Italy in the late 1950's; that's the life Tom Ripley, the con artist, craves, and Dickie Greenleaf, the rich playboy, leads. When Dickie's father, a wealthy industrialist, commissions Ripley to bring his son home to America, Dickie and his beautiful expatriate girlfriend never suspect the dangerous extremes to which Ripley will go to make their lifestyle his own."]
{'Genre': 'Feature', 'Format': 'Anamorphic, Color, Multiple Formats, NTSC, Closed-captioned, Dolby, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Philip Seymour Hoffman, Anthony Minghella, Matt Damon, Sergio Rubini, Cate Blanchett, Stefania Rocca, James Rebhorn, Philip Baker Hall, Fiorello, Patricia Highsmith, Jack Davenport, Celia Weston, Jude Law, Gwyneth PaltrowPhilip Seymour Hoffman, Anthony Minghella, Matt Damon, Sergio Rubini, Cate Blanchett, Stefania Rocca, James Rebhorn, Philip Baker Hall, Fiorello, Patricia Highsmith, Jack Davenport, Celia Weston, Jude Law, Gwyneth Paltrow   See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), Unknown (Dolby Digital 5.1), English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround), French (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround)', 'Runtime': '2 hours and 19 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'R (Restricted)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.25 x 5.25 x 0.25 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'PARD331424D', 'Director': 'Anthony Minghella', 'Media Format': 'Anamorphic, Color, Multiple Formats, NTSC, Closed-captioned, Dolby, Widescreen', 'Run time': '2 hours and 19 minutes', 'Release date': 'June 27, 2000', 'Actors': 'Matt Damon, Gwyneth Paltrow, Jude Law, Cate Blanchett, Philip Seymour Hoffman', 'Dubbed': 'French', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Studio': 'Paramount', 'Writers': 'Anthony Minghella, Patricia Highsmith', 'Number of discs': '1'}
One of my favorite movies.  Matt Damon's performance is perfect, Jude Law is wonderful and Gwyneth Paltrow is luminescent.  It is mysterious, haunting, and thought provoking.  The acting is intense and masterful and you cannot help but be drawn into the story.  The complex layers of the characters are slowly revealed and wonderfully portrayed.
Amazing performances

profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

This user demonstrates a strong appreciation for cinematic artistry, particularly in the drama genre, favoring films that feature intricate character development and compelling narratives. Their recent viewing experience highlights a newly discovered affinity for whimsical storytelling and engaging performances in comedy, specifically admiring the talents of actors who bring lighthearted yet meaningful characters to life. The user values not only intense emotional engagement but also a sense of fun and creativity, suggesting an evolving taste that embraces a broader range of narratives, including those that blend lightheartedness with depth.

While previously focused on complex plots and thought-provoking themes, their preference now extends to films that are entertaining and visually imaginative, showcasing a newfound enjoyment of artistic aesthetics in set design and wardrobe. Their discerning eye for quality remains evident, as indicated by their high ratings and enthusiastic reviews of films with standout acting, regardless of genre. Overall, this user's preferences demonstrate a balance between emotionally resonant, character-driven stories and entertaining narratives that leave a lasting impression, reflecting a dynamic appreciation for various facets of cinema.
